channel.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
channel.description:
2 or 3 years ago I saw SilentCJ modelling a Glaive, and I needed to model some more weapons for my portfolio so I also modelled the Glaive. Tell me what you think ! *Edit , I still need to unwrap and texture it, this is just the finished model.
Wireframe/Different Edges : [img]http://fotosop.nl/afbeeldingen/6342629302104Wireframe.png[/img]
Final Rendering Scenary [ Although kinda crappy quality of the image ] : [img]http://fotosop.nl/afbeeldingen/3997829302104Final Render.png[/img]
p3d : http://p3d.in/ZTw8L (Thanks The Wanderer for providing me the site ! )

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @tubefish tubefish
item.description:
@tubefish wrote:

Ok, my bad, but you do have some N-gons, which isn’t something you want. but overall the model is great!

Read full topic
item.source: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“tubefish, post:21, topic:440953”]Well, this is a great model, i see you used some primitives, and then did some tracing. which is fine. but i saw that you had some n-gons, try to stay away from those. but besides that the model is great![/quote] I’m sorry to say this but I did not do any tracing when making this model xD
I just extruded and bridged primitives so that I could get a base of the model and then reshaped those primitives to this finished product.

Read full topic

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Shouldn’t the outside edges of the glaive have an actual edge to them? I’ve never seen Blade (I know, I need to see it :P) but I don’t think it would just have a point to stab people with. Looks like it should slice people.

Read full topic

item.source: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:6, topic:440953”][quote author=Assassins Creed Fan link=topic=543631.msg3984781#msg3984781 date=1335742787]

If I were adding it to my portfolio I would subdivide it to make it look the best it can. The first few pictures make the blade seem a bit flat and not have an edge to it, but I think I can see it in the last one. Nice work! Would love to see it textured.

PS: You should check out P3D

If you mean portfolio for a job(‘demo reel’) , I don’t think you would put a glaive model in it unless it was ridiculously complex, well done, and spotless; if you can’t wow them then you drop your employment opportunities right off the bat.\

Ontopic: Not bad, but the topology feels like it needs improvement, there are some excess subdivisions on the curve of the blade which don’t show much detail and aren’t really worth the added poly, even if it is a few faces. Try thinking of how to use the least polygons for the best results. Other than that nit-picking, its pretty good. Lookin forward to the textured/revised model.
Also: Nice to see you back haven’t seen your name in this board in a loooooooong time.

It’s not for a portfolio for a demo reel, this is just a portfolio that I need to make for my 3D assignment class , we needed to make weapons of movies we like, so I thought I could model the Shutter Glaive from the Blade movies, and you’re right about the topology, I’ll look into that.
It’s just a model I made in 2hours or so, Maya crashed 2 times so I could start over haha.
It’s also good to be back (’:

[/quote]
I KNOW THE MAYA CRASH FEELING. I have gone through it time and time again. Little tip: Don’t switch between 2011 and 2012, you will corrupt your file with enough switches. I know because my maya doesnt match the school maya and I ended up with my final project for a semester corrupting the day it was do. Not just the main file, but all the backups. Thank god i had a .ma#######(the backup it saves upon crashing, in otherwords) or id have had to repeat a class I was gettin the second highest mark in…[/quote]Yeah I know right o.O I’m using 2011 just for the heck of it, always saving as .MA because one time we were working on a project and all my files were .MB and I switched to 2012 , I’ve never gotton in much deeper shit than then haha, it’s a f*cker to learn things the hard way, but that way I will never do that again xD

Read full topic
item.source: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“Assassins Creed Fan, post:5, topic:440953”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=543631.msg3984766#msg3984766 date=1335741708]

If I were adding it to my portfolio I would subdivide it to make it look the best it can. The first few pictures make the blade seem a bit flat and not have an edge to it, but I think I can see it in the last one. Nice work! Would love to see it textured.

PS: You should check out P3D

If you mean portfolio for a job(‘demo reel’) , I don’t think you would put a glaive model in it unless it was ridiculously complex, well done, and spotless; if you can’t wow them then you drop your employment opportunities right off the bat.\

Ontopic: Not bad, but the topology feels like it needs improvement, there are some excess subdivisions on the curve of the blade which don’t show much detail and aren’t really worth the added poly, even if it is a few faces. Try thinking of how to use the least polygons for the best results. Other than that nit-picking, its pretty good. Lookin forward to the textured/revised model.
Also: Nice to see you back haven’t seen your name in this board in a loooooooong time.
[/quote]
It’s not for a portfolio for a demo reel, this is just a portfolio that I need to make for my 3D assignment class , we needed to make weapons of movies we like, so I thought I could model the Shutter Glaive from the Blade movies, and you’re right about the topology, I’ll look into that.
It’s just a model I made in 2hours or so, Maya crashed 2 times so I could start over haha.
It’s also good to be back (’:[/quote]
I KNOW THE MAYA CRASH FEELING. I have gone through it time and time again. Little tip: Don’t switch between 2011 and 2012, you will corrupt your file with enough switches. I know because my maya doesnt match the school maya and I ended up with my final project for a semester corrupting the day it was do. Not just the main file, but all the backups. Thank god i had a .ma#######(the backup it saves upon crashing, in otherwords) or id have had to repeat a class I was gettin the second highest mark in…

Read full topic

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:4, topic:440953”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=543631.msg3984600#msg3984600 date=1335731446]
If I were adding it to my portfolio I would subdivide it to make it look the best it can. The first few pictures make the blade seem a bit flat and not have an edge to it, but I think I can see it in the last one. Nice work! Would love to see it textured.

PS: You should check out P3D
[/quote]
If you mean portfolio for a job(‘demo reel’) , I don’t think you would put a glaive model in it unless it was ridiculously complex, well done, and spotless; if you can’t wow them then you drop your employment opportunities right off the bat.\

Ontopic: Not bad, but the topology feels like it needs improvement, there are some excess subdivisions on the curve of the blade which don’t show much detail and aren’t really worth the added poly, even if it is a few faces. Try thinking of how to use the least polygons for the best results. Other than that nit-picking, its pretty good. Lookin forward to the textured/revised model.
Also: Nice to see you back haven’t seen your name in this board in a loooooooong time.[/quote]
It’s not for a portfolio for a demo reel, this is just a portfolio that I need to make for my 3D assignment class , we needed to make weapons of movies we like, so I thought I could model the Shutter Glaive from the Blade movies, and you’re right about the topology, I’ll look into that.
It’s just a model I made in 2hours or so, Maya crashed 2 times so I could start over haha.
It’s also good to be back (’:

Read full topic

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:2, topic:440953”]If I were adding it to my portfolio I would subdivide it to make it look the best it can. The first few pictures make the blade seem a bit flat and not have an edge to it, but I think I can see it in the last one. Nice work! Would love to see it textured.

PS: You should check out P3D[/quote]
If you mean portfolio for a job(‘demo reel’) , I don’t think you would put a glaive model in it unless it was ridiculously complex, well done, and spotless; if you can’t wow them then you drop your employment opportunities right off the bat.\

Ontopic: Not bad, but the topology feels like it needs improvement, there are some excess subdivisions on the curve of the blade which don’t show much detail and aren’t really worth the added poly, even if it is a few faces. Try thinking of how to use the least polygons for the best results. Other than that nit-picking, its pretty good. Lookin forward to the textured/revised model.
Also: Nice to see you back haven’t seen your name in this board in a loooooooong time.

item.title: Glaive Model [ From The Movie Blade ]
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

I would love to subdiv it but we need to make models that don’t have subdivs in them, to show what kind of models we can make if they are nearly as flat as they can be, they don’t need to be detailed, they just want to test our skills in ‘the game’ .
But thanks for your commentary (:
I’ll start unwrapping it tomorrow, and maybe texture it a little bit.

Read full topic
